  • Campaigning

Elections '17

  • Campaigning

Positions

President and Vice-president

The President and Vice-president is ultimately responsible for the leadership and direction of the Student Council, and by extension — all students. He or she will act as the figure head of the student body, and also help to be a part of management decisions on behalf of all University students.

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Providing strategic vision and direction
  • Managing overall operations of the Student Council
  • Making key decisions
  • Participating in management meetings and formal functions
  • Chairing committee meetings
For people who like:

to be visionary, to facilitate, to make decisions, to provide guidance, and to use their leadership to steer the strategic direction of the organization
General Secretary

The General Secretary holds the responsibility of being the official correspondence of the Student Council. He or she ensures that all internal communications and projects are at its best efficiency, and that proper records of the Student Council’s operations are recorded and maintained.

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Being the official correspondence of the Student Council
  • Writing meeting reports, formal letters, event reports and etc.
  • Employing and enforcing a variety of project management tools and standards
  • Ensuring proper records of the Student Council’s operations
For people who like:

to be organized, paperwork, writing, internal communications & operations, project management
Treasurer

The Treasurer manages all financial and monetary matters of the Student Council. He or she ensures that all accounts are up-to-date, true and fair; while also being responsibile in budgeting for the Student Council’s activities.

Their key responsibilties include:

  • Management of the Student Council’s day-to-day finances
  • Ensuring proper, up-to-date, and true reflection of the accounts
  • Creating budgets for the Student Council’s activities
  • Processing claims
For people who like:

to deal with finances, have an orderly mind and methodical way of thinking and have a good eye for detail
Academic Affairs Director

The Academic Affairs Director leads the Academic Affairs department, which is responsible for attending academic-related management committee meetings, being attentive and proactive to resolve students’ academic-related problems, to be the liaison between students, lecturers and staff for any academic-relater matters, and to ensure well communications among faculty and faculty representatives.

Their key responsibilites include:

  • Resolving academic-related matters

  • Attending academic-related management committee meetings

  • Providing feedback to enhance the quality of education

  • Provide a forum for the discussion of issues related to education

For people who like:

to work and liaise with different groups of people, to solve problems, and is concerned with the quality of education in Sunway University
Branding Director

The Branding Director leads the Branding department, which is responsible for managing the Student Council’s publicity communication channels, provide graphic designing skills and resources, promoting the Student Council’s activities, and announcing relevant updates to the student body.

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Managing the Student Council’s publicity communication channels
  • Building and maintaining the public image and reputation
  • Provide graphic designing skills and resources
  • Promoting the Student Council’s activities
  • Announcing important updates relevant to all students
For people who like:

social media, public relations, graphic designing, and is highly aware of public image
Community Service Director

The Community Service Director leads the Community Service Department, which responsibility includes creating events that allows students to reach out to the community, developing social campaigns and organizing fundraisers for a cause.

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Organizing and planning community-service related events, campaigns and fundraisers
  • Raising awareness for a greater cause
  • Getting in contact and collaborate with NGOs and social enterprises
For people who like:

charity work, event planning, and to believe and commit to a greater cause
Extra-curricular Director

The Extra-curricular Director leads the Extra-curricular Department, which is responsible for organizing events and social activities. Additionally, they also carry the responsibility of taking care of the welfare of all clubs and societies, and ensure that the campus is fun and exciting!

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Organizing and planning of events, social activities and orientations
  • Protecting the welfare, promoting, and championing student’s involvement in all student club and societies
  • Speaking and socializing with various clubs and societies
  • Solving problems!
For people who like:

to organize and plan events, to instill strong spirit and culture within the student body, to socialize and communicate with others, and solving problems
International Students Director

The International Students Director leads the International Students Department, which is responsible for organizing and engaging in social activities relevant to international students. They are also responsible in protecting and promoting the welfare of the international students.

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Organizing and planning of events and social activities relevant to international students
  • Promote cross-cultural interaction and diversity
  • Protecting and promoting the welfare of international students”
For people who like:

communicating and socializing with people, organizing & planning events
Student Welfare Director

The Student Welfare Director leads the Student Welfare Department, which is responsible for any matter concerning the welfare of students. They are the bridge between the management and the students. They will need to handle student’s feedbacks and collaborate with the management to act on it.

Their key responsibilities include:

  • Protecting the student welfare of all students
  • Solving (lots of) problems
  • Speaking and truly understanding the issues faced by students
  • Launch campaigns, events, and surveys to further a cause and change
For people who like:

communicating with people, solving problems, to be persuasive, and committing & believing that the campus environment can always be better

Be the change, make the change.
Vote Now.

Balloting Period: 8th - 12th May 2017, 10:00am - 4:00pm
